post.description: Configures list of BGP Profile to provide the parameters for the BGP protocol.

get.description: Configures list of BGP Profile to provide the parameters for the BGP protocol.

patch.description: Configures list of BGP Profile to provide the parameters for the BGP protocol.

delete.description: Configures list of BGP Profile to provide the parameters for the BGP protocol.

delete_object_type.name: object_type
delete_object_type.description: LOCAL - To delete local objects. SHARED - To delete shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

delete_scope_id.name: scope_id
delete_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

delete_persona.name: persona
delete_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_object_type.name: object_type
post_object_type.description: LOCAL - To create local objects. SHARED - To create shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

post_scope_id.name: scope_id
post_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_persona.name: persona
post_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_object_type.name: object_type
patch_object_type.description: LOCAL - To update local objects. SHARED - To update shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

patch_scope_id.name: scope_id
patch_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_persona.name: persona
patch_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

get_object_type.name: object_type
get_object_type.description: Retrieves LOCAL or SHARED or both(default) configuration objects.

get_scope_id.name: scope_id
get_scope_id.description: Configuration at a given scope. Mandatory for view_type = LOCAL.

get_persona.name: persona
get_persona.description: Filters configuration specific to given persona type. If not provided and view_type = LOCAL, then defaults to all persona.

effective.name: effective
effective.description: True - Returns effective configuration (i.e hierarchically merged configuration). False - Returns committed configuration at a given scope.

detailed.name: detailed
detailed.description: True - Includes annotations in the returned json to indicate the type of object, scope, and persona. False - Returns only config objects without annotations.

view_type.name: view_type
view_type.description: LIBRARY - Returns shared objects in library. For LIBRARY, all other parameters listed below, except 'detailed' , will be ignored. LOCAL - Returns configurations for a scope and one or more persona based on parameters below.

schema.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

X-RateLimit-Remaining.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

schema.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

X-RateLimit-Reset.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

profile.description: Configures list of BGP Profile to provide the parameters for the BGP protocol.

ANY.description: Any of local or shared config object.

ArubaBgp_BgpGlobalBase.description: Global configuration parameters for the BGP router

default-bgp-attributes.description:
Default administrative distance or preference assigned to
routes received from different sources
(external, internal, and local).

confederation.description:
Parameters indicating whether the local system acts as part
of a BGP confederation

graceful-restart.description: Parameters relating the graceful restart mechanism for BGP

timers.description: Parameters related to the BGP timers.

default-originate.description: Originate default route to BGP neighbors

max-prefix-options.description:
Parameters relating to the limit for maximum prefix
configuration options.

route-selection-options.description: Parameters relating to options for route selection

ArubaBgp_BgpGlobal.description: Global configuration options for the BGP router.

as-vrf.description: Key combination of as and vrf separated by ~

router-id.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.
router-id.description:
Router id of the router - an unsigned 32-bit integer
expressed in dotted quad notation.

oneOf.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.

route-reflector-cluster-id.description:
route-reflector cluster id to use when local router is
configured as a route reflector.

max-as-limit.description:
Limit on the maximum AS numbers allowed in the routes learned from
the peers

enable-snmp-traps.description: Enable SNMP trap generation for BGP related events.

fast-external-fallover.description: Enable fast fall-over for directly connected eBGP sessions.

aggregate-address-split-horizon.description:
If enabled, BGP will not advertise the aggregated route back to
the peer, that advertises the same network.

x-enumDescriptions.DOTTED: The AS numbers greater than 65535 should be displayed in AA.NN format
x-enumDescriptions.DOTTED_PLUS: All the AS numbers should be displayed in AA.NN format
x-enumDescriptions.PLAIN_TEXT: All the AS numbers should be displayed in plaintext format

as-notation.x-typeDescription: Specifies the representation of Four-Octet AS Numbers
as-notation.description: Specifies the representation of Four-Octet AS Numbers in show commands.

open-on-accept.description:
Configure BGP to send OPEN message immediately when the
TCP connection has been extablished for configured peers.

client-to-client-reflection.description:
Enable or disable reflection of routes between route-reflector
clients. By default, if route-reflector is configured, routes
from a client are reflected to other clients.

allow-own-as.description:
Specify the number of occurrences of the local BGP speaker's
AS that can occur within the AS_PATH before it is rejected.

nonstop.description: Enable or disable nonstop forwarding for BGP.

ArubaBgp_BgpGlobalDefaultBgpAttributes.description:
Configuration options relating to the default metric,
administrative distance or preference assigned to routes
received from different sources (external, internal, and local).

external-route-distance.description:
Administrative distance for routes learned from external
BGP (eBGP).

internal-route-distance.description:
Administrative distance for routes learned from internal
BGP (iBGP).

ArubaBgp_BgpGlobalConfederation.description:
Configuration options specifying parameters when the local
router is within an autonomous system which is part of a BGP
confederation.

identifier.x-typeDescription:
A numeric identifier for an autonomous system (AS). An AS is a
single domain, under common administrative control, which forms
a unit of routing policy. Autonomous systems can be assigned a
2-byte identifier, or a 4-byte identifier which may have public
or private scope. Private ASNs are assigned from dedicated
ranges. Public ASNs are assigned from ranges allocated by IANA
to the regional internet registries (RIRs).
identifier.description:
Confederation identifier for the autonomous system.
Setting the identifier indicates that the local-AS is part
of a BGP confederation.

items.x-typeDescription:
A numeric identifier for an autonomous system (AS). An AS is a
single domain, under common administrative control, which forms
a unit of routing policy. Autonomous systems can be assigned a
2-byte identifier, or a 4-byte identifier which may have public
or private scope. Private ASNs are assigned from dedicated
ranges. Public ASNs are assigned from ranges allocated by IANA
to the regional internet registries (RIRs).
items.description:
Remote autonomous systems that are to be treated
as part of the local confederation.

ArubaBgp_BgpGlobalGracefulRestart.description: Configuration parameters relating to BGP graceful restart.

restart-time.description:
Estimated time (in seconds) for the local BGP speaker to
restart a session. This value is advertise in the graceful
restart BGP capability.  This is a 12-bit value, referred to
as Restart Time in RFC4724.  Per RFC4724, the suggested
default value is <= the hold-time value.

stale-routes-time.description:
An upper-bound on the time thate stale routes will be
retained by a router after a session is restarted. If an
End-of-RIB (EOR) marker is received prior to this timer
expiring stale-routes will be flushed upon its receipt - if
no EOR is received, then when this timer expires stale paths
will be purged. This timer is referred to as the
Selection_Deferral_Timer in RFC4724

ArubaBgp_BgpCommonGlobalNeighborTimers.description:
Grouping used for configuration parameters relating
to BGP global and BGP neighbor specific timers.

ArubaBgp_BgpCommonGlobalNeighborAfiSafiD.description:
Grouping used for configuration parameters relating
to advertisement of default route to BGP neighbors.

default-originate-enable.description: Originate default route to the neighbors

route-map.description: Route-map to specify criteria to originate default

ArubaBgp_BgpGlobalRouteSelectionOptions.description:
Set of configuration options that govern best
path selection.

always-compare-med.description:
Compare multi-exit discriminator (MED) value of the routes
from peers of different ASes when selecting the best route.

deterministic-med.description:
Compare multi-exit discriminator (MED) value of the routes
advertised by different peers in the same AS when selecting
the best route.

compare-med-confederation.description:
Compare multi-exit discriminator (MED) value of the routes
from peers of different ASes within a confederation when
selecting the best route.

med-missing-as-worst.description:
Consider MED value as worst (0xFFFFFFFF), if MED
attribute is missing in the routes when selecting
the best route.

ignore-as-path-length.description:
Ignore the AS path length when selecting the best path.
The default is to use the AS path length and prefer paths
with shorter length.

as-path-multipath-relax.description:
Consider two or more BGP routes as ECMP routes when
routes AS PATH length is same but AS PATHs are different.

compare-router-id.description:
When comparing similar routes received from external
BGP peers, use the router-id as a criterion to select
the active path.

compare-originator-id.description:
When comparing similar routes received from external
BGP peers, use the originator-id as a criterion to select
the active path.

ArubaBgp_BgpGlobalLoggingOptions.description:
Configuration parameters specifying the logging behaviour for
BGP sessions to the peers

log-neighbor-state-changes.description:
Configure logging of peer state changes.  Default is
to disable logging of peer state changes.

log-neighbor-state-changes-prefix-list.description:
Specify a prefix-list to filter log messages from specific
BGP neighbors only.

ArubaBgp_BgpGlobalAfiSafi.description: List of address-families associated with the BGP instance

global-afi-safi.description:
AFI,SAFI configuration available for the
neighbor or group

address-family.x-typeDescription:
AFI (Address Family Identifier) and
SAFI (Sub-Address Family Identifier) combinations
address-family.description:
Reference to the AFI-SAFI name used as a key
for the AFI-SAFI list

ArubaBgp_BgpGlobalBgpDampening.description: Configuration relating to BGP route-flap dampening.

bgp-dampening.description: Parameters relating to BGP route-flap dampening.

half-life.description:
Amount of time (in minutes) that must elapse to reduce
the penalty by one half.

reuse-limit.description:
If the penalty is greater than the suppress limit,
the route is suppressed.

suppress-limit.description:
If the penalty is greater than the suppress limit,
the route is suppressed.

max-suppress-time.description: The maximum amount of time (in minutes) that a route can be suppressed.

route-map.description: The route-map to be applied for BGP route-flap dampening.

ArubaBgp_BgpGlobalUseMultiplePaths.description:
Grouping which provides configuration parameters relating
to use of multiple paths

use-multiple-paths.description:
Parameters related to the use of multiple paths for the
same NLRI

enabled.description:
Whether the use of multiple paths for the same NLRI is
enabled for BGP neighbors in the same Autonomous System.

ArubaBgp_BgpGlobalIpv4Network.description: Configurations relating to BGP IPv4 networks.

network.description: Specify a network to announce via BGP

prefix.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 prefix represented in dotted quad notation followed by
a slash and a CIDR mask (0 <= mask <= 32).

ArubaBgp_BgpGlobalIpv6Network.description: Configurations relating to BGP IPv6 networks.

network.description: Specify a network to announce via BGP

prefix.x-typeDescription:
An IPv6 prefix represented in full, shortened, or mixed
shortened format followed by a slash and CIDR mask
(0 <= mask <= 128).

ArubaBgp_BgpGlobalIpv4Redistribute.description: Configurations relating to redistribution rules for IPv4 routes.

x-enumDescriptions.RAPNG_VPN: RAPNG-VPN(Remote Access Point Next Gen - Virtual Private Network) routes

route-type.x-typeDescription: Types of redistribute routes to BGP.
route-type.description: The type of the route to be redistributed to BGP.

ArubaBgp_BgpGlobalIpv6Redistribute.description: Configurations relating to redistribution rules for IPv6 routes.

x-enumDescriptions.RAPNG_VPN: RAPNG-VPN(Remote Access Point Next Gen - Virtual Private Network) routes

route-type.x-typeDescription: Types of redistribute routes to BGP.
route-type.description: The type of the route to be redistributed to BGP.

ArubaBgp_BgpGlobalIpv4AggregateAddressGr.description: Configurations relating to BGP IPv4 aggregate addresses.

aggregate-address.description: Aggregate addresses keyed by the IPv4 address and mask.

address.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 prefix represented in dotted quad notation followed by
a slash and a CIDR mask (0 <= mask <= 32).

summary-only.description: Filter more specific routes from updates

advertise-map.description: Route-map to select the routes to be advertised.

attribute-map.description: Route-map to set attributes of the aggregate-route.

suppress-map.description: Route-map to select the routes to be suppressed.

aggregate-address-sources.x-typeDescription: Type of source protocol to aggregate.
aggregate-address-sources.description: Aggregate the routes sourced by different types of protocols.

ArubaBgp_BgpGlobalIpv6AggregateAddressGr.description: Configurations relating to BGP IPv6 aggregate addresses.

aggregate-address.description: Aggregate addresses keyed by the IPv6 address and mask.

address.x-typeDescription:
An IPv6 prefix represented in full, shortened, or mixed
shortened format followed by a slash and CIDR mask
(0 <= mask <= 128).

summary-only.description: Filter more specific routes from updates

advertise-map.description: Route-map to select the routes to be advertised.

attribute-map.description: Route-map to set attributes of the aggregate-route.

suppress-map.description: Route-map to select the routes to be suppressed.

neighbor.description:
List of BGP neighbors configured on the local system,
uniquely identified by peer IP address.

oneOf.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.

An IPv6 address represented as either a full address; shortened
or mixed-shortened formats, using the default zone.

neighbor-id.description: Address of the BGP peer, either in IPv4 or IPv6

peer-group.description: The peer-group with which this neighbor is associated

peer-as.x-typeDescription:
A numeric identifier for an autonomous system (AS). An AS is a
single domain, under common administrative control, which forms
a unit of routing policy. Autonomous systems can be assigned a
2-byte identifier, or a 4-byte identifier which may have public
or private scope. Private ASNs are assigned from dedicated
ranges. Public ASNs are assigned from ranges allocated by IANA
to the regional internet registries (RIRs).

slow-peer.description:
Set to true to indicate that the neighbor is a slow peer.
slow peers that have same outbound policy gets placed in a
separate update-group.

peer-group.description:
List of BGP peer-groups configured on the local system,
uniquely identified by name of the peer-group.

peer-as.x-typeDescription:
A numeric identifier for an autonomous system (AS). An AS is a
single domain, under common administrative control, which forms
a unit of routing policy. Autonomous systems can be assigned a
2-byte identifier, or a 4-byte identifier which may have public
or private scope. Private ASNs are assigned from dedicated
ranges. Public ASNs are assigned from ranges allocated by IANA
to the regional internet registries (RIRs).

listen-parameters.description: Listen parameters for BGP dynamic neighbors.

oneOf.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 prefix represented in dotted quad notation followed by
a slash and a CIDR mask (0 <= mask <= 32).

An IPv6 prefix represented in full, shortened, or mixed
shortened format followed by a slash and CIDR mask
(0 <= mask <= 128).

ip-range.description: The range of IP addresses that are allowed as BGP dynamic neighbors.

as-range.description: The allowed AS range for BGP dynamic peers, Example 100,65001-65010.

max-limit.description: The allowed max-limit for BGP dynamic peers.

ArubaBgp_BgpPeerBaseGrouping.description: Parameters related to BGP neighbor or BGP peer group.

timers.description: Timers related to a BGP neighbor

transport.description: Transport session parameters for the BGP neighbor

error-handling.description:
Error handling parameters used for the BGP neighbor or
group

graceful-shutdown.description:
Graceful shutdown parameters used for the BGP neighbor
or group

tcp-ao-options.description:
TCP-AO (TCP Authentication Option) options used for
the BGP neighbor or group

ArubaBgp_BgpPeergroupBaseGrouping.description: Parameters related to BGP neighbor or BGP peer group.

timers.description: Timers related to a BGP neighbor

transport.description: Transport session parameters for the BGP neighbor

error-handling.description:
Error handling parameters used for the BGP neighbor or
group

graceful-shutdown.description:
Graceful shutdown parameters used for the BGP neighbor
or group

tcp-ao-options.description:
TCP-AO (TCP Authentication Option) options used for
the BGP neighbor or group

ArubaBgp_BgpNeighborGrouping.description:
Configuration parameters relating to a base BGP neighbor that
are also applicable to peer group context.

enabled.description:
Whether the BGP peer is enabled. In cases where the
enabled leaf is set to false, the local system should not
initiate connections to the neighbor, and should not
respond to TCP connections attempts from the neighbor. If
the state of the BGP session is ESTABLISHED at the time
that this leaf is set to false, the BGP session should be
ceased.

local-as.x-typeDescription:
A numeric identifier for an autonomous system (AS). An AS is a
single domain, under common administrative control, which forms
a unit of routing policy. Autonomous systems can be assigned a
2-byte identifier, or a 4-byte identifier which may have public
or private scope. Private ASNs are assigned from dedicated
ranges. Public ASNs are assigned from ranges allocated by IANA
to the regional internet registries (RIRs).
local-as.description:
The local autonomous system number that is to be used
when establishing sessions with the remote peer or peer
group, if this differs from the global BGP router
autonomous system number.

x-enumDescriptions.NO_PREPEND_REPLACE_AS_DUAL_AS:
The session can be established using either primary-as or alternate local-as.
Selected-as is not prepended to the inbound AS_PATH list,
but prepended to outbound AS_PATH list.
x-enumDescriptions.NO_PREPEND_REPLACE_AS:
The session is established via alternate local-as.
Both the alternate-as and primary-as are not prepended to the inbound AS_PATH list,
but alternate local-as is prepended to the outbound AS_PATH list.
x-enumDescriptions.NO_PREPEND:
The session is established via alternate local-as.
Both the alternate-as and primary-as are not prepended to the inbound AS_PATH list,
but prepended to the outbound AS_PATH list.

local-as-mode.x-typeDescription: The modes of using specified ASN as local AS for forming BGP sessions with peers.
local-as-mode.description: The different modes of using ASN as local AS.

auth-password.x-typeDescription:
A custom derived type for special use cases. This type takes a plaintext password and uses
Vault's 3rd party API to encrypt the password. The intended use case is to encrypt and store
customer credentials which will be used later to login to 3rd party services.
auth-password.description:
Configures an MD5 authentication password for use with
neighboring devices.

remove-private-as.description:
Remove private AS numbers from updates sent to peers - when
this leaf is not specified, the AS_PATH attribute should be
sent to the peer unchanged

description.description:
An optional textual description (intended primarily for use
with a peer or group

fall-over.description: Fall-over the BGP session when route to the peer fails.

fall-over-bfd.description:
Enable BFD session with the neighbor and fall-over the BGP
session when connectivity with the neighbor is lost.

ignore-leading-as.description:
Accept the received routes from the peer even if it does
not have their own AS appended to the as-path.

weight.description: This is the weight for routes from this neighbor.

use-med.description:
Enable the comparison of MED attribute for the same route
received from two different autonomous systems.

as-override.description:
Replace all occurrences of the peer AS number with the
router's own AS number before advertising the route.

ArubaBgp_BgpNeighborCapabilitiesGrouping.description:
Configuration parameters relating to the advertisement of
capabilities to the peer

route-refresh-capability.description:
Enable the advertisement of route-refresh capability in
the Open message sent to the peer.

graceful-restart-capability.description:
Enable the advertisement of graceful-restart capability in
the Open message sent to the peer.

dynamic-capability.description:
Enable the advertisement of dynamic capability in
the Open message sent to the peer.

ArubaBgp_BgpNeighborTransportGrouping.description:
Configuration parameters relating to the transport protocol
used by the BGP session to the peer

tcp-port.x-typeDescription:
A 16-bit port number used by a transport protocol such as TCP
or UDP.
tcp-port.description:
Source TCP port number of the local router when initiating a
session to BGP peer

passive-mode.description:
Wait for peers to issue requests to open a BGP session,
rather than initiating sessions from the local router.

oneOf.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.

An IPv6 address represented as either a full address; shortened
or mixed-shortened formats, using the default zone.

local-ip-address.description:
Set the local IP (either IPv4 or IPv6) address to use
for the session when sending BGP update messages.

local-loopback-interface.description:
Use the IP (either IPv4 or IPv6) address of
loopback interface to form BGP session with others.

local-vlan-interface.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN
local-vlan-interface.description:
Use the IP (either IPv4 or IPv6) address of
vlan interface to form BGP session with others.

local-lag-interface.description:
Use the IP (either IPv4 or IPv6) address of
lag interface to form BGP session with others.

ArubaBgp_BgpNeighborErrorHandlingGroupin.description:
Configuration parameters relating to enhanced error handling
behaviours for BGP

treat-as-withdraw.description:
Specify whether erroneous UPDATE messages for which the
NLRI can be extracted are treated as though the NLRI is
withdrawn - avoiding session reset

ArubaBgp_BgpNeighborGracefulShutdownGrou.description:
Configuration parameters relating to graceful shutdown
behaviours for BGP sessions

timer.description: Time to wait before shutting down the the BGP neighbor.

local-preference.description: The local-preference value to be advertised before graceful shutdown.

ArubaBgp_BgpNeighborTcpAoOptionsGrouping.description:
Configuration parameters relating to TCP-AO options
for BGP sessions

include-tcp-options.description: Include the TCP header options for MAC calculation.

accept-ao-mismatch.description:
Indicates whether the receiver should accept
segments for which the MAC in the incoming TCP AO does
not match the MAC generated on the receiver.

ArubaBgp_BgpNeighborMultihopGrouping.description:
Configuration parameters specifying the multihop behaviour for
BGP sessions to the peer

ebgp-multihop-ttl.description:
Time-to-live value to use when packets are sent to the
referenced eBGP neighbors and ebgp-multihop is enabled

ttl-security-hops.description:
Maximum allowed hops to a neighbor. This, when configured takes
precedence over multihop-ttl.

ebgp-multihop.description: Accept or initiate connections to external peers on networks that are not directly connected.

ArubaBgp_BgpPeerAfiSafi.description: Configuration parameters used for all BGP peer AFI-SAFIs

afi-safi.description:
AFI,SAFI configuration available for the
neighbor or group

address-family.x-typeDescription:
AFI (Address Family Identifier) and
SAFI (Sub-Address Family Identifier) combinations
address-family.description: AFI-SAFI name used as a key for the AFI-SAFI list

default-originate.description: Originate default route to the neighbors

max-prefix-options.description:
Parameters relating to BGP neighbor specific limit for
maximum prefix configuration options.

default-originate.description: Originate default route to this neighbor

max-prefix-options.description:
Parameters relating to BGP neighbor specific limit for
maximum prefix configuration options.

ArubaBgp_BgpPeergroupAfiSafi.description: List of address-families associated with the BGP neighbor

afi-safi.description:
AFI,SAFI configuration available for the
neighbor or group

address-family.x-typeDescription:
AFI (Address Family Identifier) and
SAFI (Sub-Address Family Identifier) combinations
address-family.description: AFI-SAFI name used as a key for the AFI-SAFI list

default-originate.description: Originate default route to the neighbors

max-prefix-options.description:
Parameters relating to BGP neighbor specific limit for
maximum prefix configuration options.

default-originate.description: Originate default route to this neighbor

max-prefix-options.description:
Parameters relating to BGP neighbor specific limit for
maximum prefix configuration options.

ArubaBgp_BgpPeerAllAfiSafi.description:
Configuration parameters used for all BGP neighbors
AFI-SAFIs

enabled.description:
This leaf indicates whether the AFI-SAFI is
enabled for the neighbor or group

ArubaBgp_BgpNeighborAllAfiSafi.description:
Configuration parameters used for all BGP neighbors
or groups AFI-SAFIs

route-reflector-client.description: Configure the neighbor as a route reflector client.

send-community.description: Send Community attribute to this neighbor

send-community-enable.description: Enable sending the community attributes to the peer.

type.description:
Specify which types of community should be sent to the
neighbor or group.

allow-own-as.description:
Specify the number of occurrences of the local BGP speaker's
AS that can occur within the AS_PATH before it is rejected.

enable-allow-own-as.description: Allow BGP update message even if own is present.

x-enumDescriptions.INBOUND: Inbound direction of the route-map for BGP peer
x-enumDescriptions.OUTBOUND: Inbound direction of the route-map for BGP peer

direction.x-typeDescription: Direction of the route-map for BGP peer
direction.description: Specify the direction of the route-map to be applied.

route-map.description: Specify the the route-map to be applied.

ArubaBgp_BgpNeighborAfiSafiAddPaths.description:
Configuration parameters specfying whether the local system
will send or receive multiple paths using ADD_PATHS

add-paths.description:
Parameters relating to the advertisement and receipt of
multiple paths for a single NLRI (add-paths)

x-enumDescriptions.RECEIVE:
Enable capability negotiation to receive multiple path
advertisements for an NLRI from the neighbor or group
x-enumDescriptions.SEND:
Enable capability negotiation to send multiple path
advertisements for an NLRI from the neighbor or group
x-enumDescriptions.BOTH:
Enable capability negotiation to send and receive multiple path
advertisements for an NLRI from the neighbor or group

direction.x-typeDescription: Multiple path advertisement capability for an NLRI from peer or group
direction.description: Multiple path advertisement capability for an NLRI from peer or group

send-max.description:
The maximum total number of paths to advertise to neighbors
for a single NLRI.  This includes the single best path as
well as additional paths advertised when add-paths is
enabled.

ArubaBgp_BgpNeighborAfiSafiTimers.description:
Grouping used for configuration parameters relating
to BGP neighbor specific timers.

minimum-advertisement-interval.description:
Minimum time which must elapse between subsequent UPDATE
messages relating to a common set of NLRI being transmitted
to a peer. This timer is referred to as
MinRouteAdvertisementIntervalTimer by RFC 4721 and serves to
reduce the number of UPDATE messages transmitted when a
particular set of NLRI exhibit instability.

ArubaBgp_BgpCommonGlobalNeighborAfiSafiM.description:
Grouping used for configuration parameters relating
to BGP neighbor specific limit for maximum prefixes.

limit.description:
The maximum number of prefixes that can be learnt from
the BGP neighbor.

threshold.description: Threshold at which a warning message has to be generated.

restart-time.description:
Time to wait after maximum prefix limit is reached to restart
the session with the BGP neighbor.

x-enumDescriptions.NONE:
No action is taken, when the number of prefixes
exceeds the maximum limit.
x-enumDescriptions.WARNING_ONLY:
Only generate a warning message, when the
number of prefixes exceeds the maximum limit.
x-enumDescriptions.RESTART:
Restart the BGP session, when the number of
prefixes exceeds the maximum limit.
x-enumDescriptions.BLOCK:
Block the addition of routes, when the number
of prefixes exceeds the maximum limit.

action.x-typeDescription: The action to be taken when maximum prefix limit is reached.
action.description: The action to be taken when maximum prefix limit is reached.

ArubaBgp_BgpNeighborAfiSafiNextHopSelf.description:
Grouping used for configuration parameters relating
to BGP neighbor next-hop-self behavior.

next-hop-self.description:
Set the nexthop of the routes to self IP, while advertising
routes to BGP neighbor.

ArubaBgp_BgpNeighborReplaceRtAsn.description:
enables the BGP router to replace the ASN portion of the route target
in the received BGP update message with the local AS number when considering for import.

ArubaBgp_BgpGlobalAfiSafiMaxPaths.description: Number of BGP Paths to a network destination

maximum-paths.description:
Maximum number of parallel paths to consider when using
BGP multipath. The default is 4.

ArubaBgp_BgpNeighborAfiSafiNextHopUnchan.description:
Grouping used for configuration parameters relating
to BGP neighbor next-hop-unchanged behavior.

next-hop-unchanged.description:
Keep the nexthop of the routes unchanged, while advertising
routes to BGP neighbor.

ArubaBgp_BgpNeighborIpv4UnicastOrf.description:
Grouping used for configuration parameters relating
to ORF configurations of BGP neighbors.

x-enumDescriptions.SEND:
This capability enables sending prefix list information
to the neighbor
x-enumDescriptions.RECEIVE:
This capability enables receiving prefix list information
from the neighbor
x-enumDescriptions.BOTH:
This capability enables both sending and receiving
prefix list information for the neighbor

orf-capability.description: Advertise ORF prefix-list capability to this neighbor.

orf.description: Apply ORF(Outbound Route Filter) prefix-list to the neighbor

direction.x-typeDescription: Specifies the direction of ORF prefix-list to be applied.
direction.description: Direction of the ORF prefix-list to be applied.

ArubaBgp_BgpNeighborIpv6UnicastOrf.description:
Grouping used for configuration parameters relating
to ORF configurations of BGP neighbors.

x-enumDescriptions.SEND:
This capability enables sending prefix list information
to the neighbor
x-enumDescriptions.RECEIVE:
This capability enables receiving prefix list information
from the neighbor
x-enumDescriptions.BOTH:
This capability enables both sending and receiving
prefix list information for the neighbor

orf-capability.description: Advertise ORF prefix-list capability to this neighbor.

orf.description: Apply ORF(Outbound Route Filter) prefix-list to the neighbor

direction.x-typeDescription: Specifies the direction of ORF prefix-list to be applied.
direction.description: Direction of the ORF prefix-list to be applied.

prefix-list.description: Specify the the prefix-list to be applied.

ArubaBgp_BgpNeighborAfiSafiInboundSoftRe.description:
Grouping used for configuration parameters relating
to BGP neighbor inbound soft-reconfiguration.

inbound-soft-reconfiguration.description: Allow inbound soft reconfiguration with the BGP neighbor.

Error400.description: Error details returned from the server.

message.example: Bad request. Invalid values supplied in request.

Error401.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error403.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error404.description: Error details returned from the server.

message.example: Not found. Yang / Corresponding Rule is missing.

Error406.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error408.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error412.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error429.description: Error details returned from the server.
